docs.snippet: Two months before Election Day, early voting kicks off next week in North Carolina, the first in a run of key states where minority voters and young adults who cast ballots in advance could give one of the White House contenders a decisive advanta...
docs.lead_paragraph: Two months before Election Day, early voting kicks off next week in North Carolina, the first in a run of key states where minority voters and young adults who cast ballots in advance could give one of the White House contenders a decisive advantage.

headline.main: Early Voting Already: Trump Chances May Hinge on Non-Whites

docs.snippet: Donald Trump swayed to songs of worship, read scripture, and donned a Jewish prayer shawl Saturday during a visit to a predominantly black church in Detroit, where he called for a "civil rights agenda for our time" and vowed to fix the "many wrong...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump swayed to songs of worship, read scripture, and donned a Jewish prayer shawl Saturday during a visit to a predominantly black church in Detroit, where he called for a "civil rights agenda for our time" and vowed to fix the "many wrongs" facing African-Americans.

headline.main: Trump Tells Black Churchgoers in Detroit Visit Is 'to Learn'
headline.print_headline: Trump Tells Black Churchgoers in Detroit Visit Is 'to Learn'

docs.snippet: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump stepped up his bid to win over minority voters by addressing a largely black church in Detroit on Saturday and calling for a new civil rights agenda to support African-Americans....

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton, under questioning by federal investigators over whether she had been briefed on how to preserve government records as she was about to leave the State Department, said she had suffered a concussion, was working part-time and could...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton, under questioning by federal investigators over whether she had been briefed on how to preserve government records as she was about to leave the State Department, said she had suffered a concussion, was working part-time and could not recall every briefing she received.

headline.main: Clinton Tells FBI She Could Not Recall All Briefings on Preserving Documents
headline.print_headline: Clinton Tells FBI She Could Not Recall All Briefings on Preserving Documents

docs.snippet: Young Hispanics, Asian-Americans and African-Americans are much more likely to trust Hillary Clinton than Donald Trump to deal with immigrants living in the United States illegally. But young whites tend to trust Trump more on issues related to il...
docs.lead_paragraph: Young Hispanics, Asian-Americans and African-Americans are much more likely to trust Hillary Clinton than Donald Trump to deal with immigrants living in the United States illegally. But young whites tend to trust Trump more on issues related to illegal immigration, including securing the border.
